channel.title: The ::pickup for items above 10,000 {post one please}

item.title: The ::pickup for items above 10,000 {post one please}
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 2) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(8,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (/*newItemID <= 11999 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Excist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type It Right ! "); } }

This one worked for me, however, the IDs are changed at the moment, and the foreseeable future doesn’t look good, and it prevents you from spawning ids below 10000 :p.

Read full topic

item.title: The ::pickup for items above 10,000 {post one please}
item.dc:creator: @A.E.M A.E.M.
item.description:
@A.E.M wrote:

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("im so 1337") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }

there this will solve lots of headache’s

item.title: The ::pickup for items above 10,000 {post one please}
item.dc:creator: @bl1tz bl1tz
item.description:
@bl1tz wrote:

now, alot of people have been asking fot it.

if someone could post a FULL tutorial for the n00bz that cant read/write or code, im sure it would help mrs. silabsoft out alot…

she is under alot of stress at the moment.

so would sum1 mind posting it.

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("im so 1337") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 10000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }
